name: electricity voltage transformation from high to medium voltage | electricity, medium voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9666/documentation

This dataset represents the transformation of electricity voltage from high to medium voltage. The losses are based on electricity generation and trade statistics: IEA World Energy Statistics and Balances, ISSN: 16834240, https://doi.org/10.1787/enestats-data-en Definition of the voltage levels: - High voltage level above 24 kV (large scale industry) - Medium voltage level between 1 kV and 24 kV (medium to small scale industry, service sector and public buildings) - Low voltage level below 1 kV (Households)

This activity starts with the high voltage electricity arriving at the transformer station.

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity transformed to medium voltage. This dataset includes the losses during voltage transformation. It doesn't include the transformer station itself as this is included in the dataset for the transmission network.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for the peruvian context in year 2014 was used.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Transformers are essential components of the electricity grid. They connect the different voltage levels.;Big power plants feed the electricity at a very high voltage to the electricity grid. Transformers between 600 MVA and 80 MVA can be found in substations, where the high transmission voltage is transformed to the medium distribution voltage. In an additional step the medium voltage is transformed to low voltage using transformers below 2.5 MVA. The small transformers below 2.5 MVA are allocated to the low voltage level, whereas all the other transformers are allocated to the medium voltage level.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The share of the total losses was allocated to the different voltage levels based on generic data from Switzerland in 2009 ( Itten R., Frischknecht R., Stucki M. 2014). High voltage level (>24 kV) Fraction of total consumption at high voltage level (generic, data taken from Switzerland): 4%. Total losses on high voltage level (generic, data taken from the City of Zürich in 2009): 39% Of which: Transmission: 33% Of which: Transformation: 6% Medium voltage level (1kV - 24 kV) Fraction of total consumption at medium voltage level (generic, data taken from Switzerland): 32%. Total losses on medium voltage level (generic, data taken from the City of Zürich in 2009): 13% Of which: Transmission: 5% Of which: Transformation: 8% Low voltage level (>1kV) Fraction of total consumption at low voltage level (generic, data taken from Switzerland): 64%. Total losses on medium voltage level (generic, data taken from the City of Zürich in 2009): 48% Of which: Transmission: 24% Of which: Transformation: 24% Sources: COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/11_OPERACION DEL SISTEMA DE TRANSMISION, CUADRO N° 11.3 PÉRDIDAS EN EL SISTEMA DE TRANSMISIÓN (page 7). August, 22 2017 Itten R., Frischknecht R., Stucki M. 2014. Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. Version 1.3. treeze, Uster, Switzerland
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data on the total electricity production (41796 GWh) and total transmission losses (1590 GWh) were obtained from (COES, 2014 and MINEM, 2015). COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/11_OPERACION DEL SISTEMA DE TRANSMISION, CUADRO N° 11.3 PÉRDIDAS EN EL SISTEMA DE TRANSMISIÓN (page 7). August, 22 2017

flow.name: electricity, medium voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description: Calculated value/estimation. This value compensates for the losses during transformation from high to medium voltage. The calculation is made based on total electricity losses between net electricity available at the busbar and the use of electricity calculated based on the IEA electricity information, data valid for the year 2020. These total losses over the whole chain are then allocated to the different voltage levels as well as transformation and transmission losses based on information in Itten et al. 2014. For details please see the documentation available on ecoQuery. IEA. 2016. Electricity Information 2016. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR). Itten R., Frischknecht R., Stucki M. 2014. Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. Version 1.3. treeze, Uster, Switzerland
